data.meta_description: Édouard Adolphe Casimir Joseph Mortier was a Marshal of France was given command of the Imperial Guard, but at the opening of the Battle of Waterloo he was unable to continue due to severe sciatica.  In 1835, while accompanying Louis-Philippe to a review, he and 11 others were killed by the 'infernal machine' – a weapon of 25 musket barrels firing simultaneously aimed at the king by a disgruntled outcast. Louis Philippe bitterly mourned him, and wept openly at the marshal's funeral.
